intro: Feuilleea mathewsii, commonly known as the Matthews' leaf plant, is a rare species native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that store water, enabling it to survive in dry conditions. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and has a low, spreading growth habit. Its flowers are small and usually appear in clusters, often in shades of yellow or orange. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
